Package com.twiceagain.selescript.compiler

Class SSCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twiceagain.selescript.compiler.SSCompiler
  • public final class SSCompiler
extends java.lang.Object
    The Compiler is constructed with source input, asked to compile, and then can return code or save it.
    Author:
    xavier

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected Config config
      The configuration object defining the compilation context.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SSCompiler​(Config conf)
      Compile according to the provided configuration object.This is the prefered way to go.
      SSCompiler​(Config conf, java.lang.String scriptCode)
      Compile from string, using the provide configuration.
      SSCompiler​(java.lang.String scriptCode)
      Compile from String, mainly for debugging purpose.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void compile​(org.antlr.v4.runtime.CharStream in)
      Do the actual compilation.
      void dump()
      Dumps the full annotated tree.
      void dump​(org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.ParseTree node)
      Dumps the annotated tree or sub-tree.
      java.lang.String getCode()
      The final code will be found as the attribute of the tree root.
      java.lang.String getCodeHash()
      Retun a hash of the generated code, excluding the variable properties (time dependant, ...) so that this value is expected to stay the same accross successive compilations.
      java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
      Get the first (there can be more) error message.
      java.lang.String getTreeString()
      Get the parsed tree (for debugging).
      boolean hasSyntaxError()
      Check if a syntax error was detected during compilation.
      void saveCode()
      Ask the config obejct to save the code.

    • Field Detail

      • config

        protected Config config
        The configuration object defining the compilation context.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SSCompiler

        public SSCompiler​(Config conf)
        Compile according to the provided configuration object.This is the prefered way to go. The code is generated, but not saved, until the compiler is requested to do so.
        Parameters:
        conf -

      • SSCompiler

        public SSCompiler​(java.lang.String scriptCode)
        Compile from String, mainly for debugging purpose. Creates its own debug-friendly configuration : dryrun, debugmode.
        Parameters:
        scriptCode -

      • SSCompiler

        public SSCompiler​(Config conf,
                  java.lang.String scriptCode)
        Compile from string, using the provide configuration. Dryrun will be forced. If config is null, a debug/dryrun config is created.
        Parameters:
        conf -
        scriptCode -

    • Method Detail

        Do the actual compilation.
        Parameters:

      • getCode

        public java.lang.String getCode()
        The final code will be found as the attribute of the tree root.
        Returns:

      • getCodeHash

        public java.lang.String getCodeHash()
        Retun a hash of the generated code, excluding the variable properties (time dependant, ...) so that this value is expected to stay the same accross successive compilations. In practice, anything happening BEFORE the first occurence of 'public void scrap' is ignored.
        Returns:

      • saveCode

        public void saveCode()
        Ask the config obejct to save the code.

      • hasSyntaxError

        public boolean hasSyntaxError()
        Check if a syntax error was detected during compilation.
        Returns:
